page.title: 10PEAT CUTTING IN BETTYHILL
page.content: {PEAT CUTTING IN BETTYHILL It may seem amazing to most people in Britain but the main fuel used in our area is peat. Visitors to the area tend to think that we just pick it up of the hillside but there is actually an awful lot of work involved before the soft wet material most people know as peat, can become a hard, dry fuel. Peat is made up of semi-decomposed vegetable matter and is almost ninety per cent water when in its natural state. The work of converting is done in several stages. All crofters have the right to cut peats on the hill and most take advantage of this, as alternatives like coal are very expensive.
